name: finalsize
description: finalsize is an R package that provides estimates for the total proportion of a population infected over the course of an epidemic, and can account for a demographic distribution, demography-specific contact patterns,and heterogeneous susceptibility to infection between groups.

sdgs.relevance: finalsize was created under the Epiverse initiative, which is a global collaborative working to develop a trustworthy data analysis ecosystem dedicated to preparing for the next public health crisis. finalsize can provide policy makers and health agencies with rough estimates of the effectiveness of pharmaceutical interventions in the form of immunisation programmes, or the effect of naturally acquired immunity through previous infection. This information allows for greater insights and understanding around diseases transmission and the vaccine efficacy, thus helping decision makers assess the total portion of population infected over the course of an epidemic and how to distribute services and medicines to areas in most need.

protectionFromHarassment.harassmentPolicy:
The Epiverse Code of Conduct is upheld for each of our open source software tools: https://github.com/epiverse-trace/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Examples of behaviours which are not welcome in our community include (but are not limited to):
Unwelcome sexual attention or physical contact.
Personal attacks, including derogatory comments, insulting, ignoring, shaming or belittling others.
Public or private harassment.
Publishing others’ private information without their express permission.
Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting.

The Community Manager and members of the Epiverse-TRACE team are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of acceptable behaviour and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in response to any behaviour that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.

The Community Manager and members of the Epiverse-TRACE team have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments, commits, code, and other contributions that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation decisions when appropriate.

The Code of Conduct Committee will determine appropriate enforcement measures on a case-by-case basis. Where practicable, violations to this code of conduct will be addressed informally in the first instance. For example through a verbal or written warning. Repeated or serious violations may result in more sustained ramifications, including a temporary or permanent ban from community spaces (e.g. forums, events) and, where necessary, the involvement of law authorities.

Incidents can be reported to the Epiverse-TRACE Code of Conduct Committee through completing this short form:  https://forms.gle/guKqVXPk6K43jPn59

clearOwnership.clearOwnershipURL:
Pratik Gupte is the official maintainer, as shown on the CRAN page (https://cran.r-project.org/package=finalsize) and as documented by the "cre" role in DESCRIPTIONn. 

However, everybody who contributed to the code is a copyright holder, or "owner", as documented by the use of "finalsize authors" in the LICENSE. In the large majority of cases, there is no copyright transfer during the open-source contribution process.

documentation:
finalsize is documented in GitHub and CRAN
The current development version of finalsize can be installed from Github using the remotes package. 

GitHub: https://epiverse-trace.github.io/finalsize/
CRAN: https://cloud.r-project.org/web/packages/finalsize/index.html

More details on how to use finalsize can be found in the online documentation as package vignettes, under “Articles”: https://epiverse-trace.github.io/finalsize/

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

userContent.contentManagement: Content is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

otherDeploymentOrganisations: finalsize is relatively new and has not been formally implemented or scaled. However
it is already publicly available for everyone with the CRAN archive or the public GitHub repository.
openStandards: Epiverse-TRACE tools follow general open-source/standards principles. Our MIT License ensures that users can access
and distribute the code freely. Additionally
our projects use use GitHub as our code  to manage source code and allows users to easily access the code

and collaborate on development.
 
Our adherence to open standards/source are also demonstrated in our documentation

and contribute to the project. We strive to make our documentation acessible and understandable to users of all skill levels.

Finally
finalsize is maintained by an active community of users (Epiverse-TRACE) and contributors who provide feedback
and contribute to the project. This community helps to ensure the quality and sustainability of the project over time.
bestPractices:
finalsize adheres to the Principles for Digital Development. 

1) It has been designed with the needs and perspectives of the end-users in mind. This can be achieved through user research

and feedback from the community.

2) finalsize is designed in a way that integrates with existing tools and infrastructure

and does not create new silos or dependencies.

3) finalsize designed with strong privacy and security measures in place

and should comply with relevant data protection regulations.

4) finalsize is developed in a collaborative and transparent manner

with clear documentation and guidelines for contributors.

5) It designed in a way that allows for easy reuse and modification
with clear licensing and documentation to support these efforts.

privacy.privacyCompliance:
finalsize only uses non personal, publicly available information and doesn't save or export any kind of user data or analytics.

finalsize only uses free and open source software and open data, strictly under the terms defined by their respective licenses
